title: How to Make Sure if a TV Remote Is Broken Using any Camera

steps.headline: Take a camera.
steps.description: Bring out a camera, such as a mobile phone's or a digital camera.

steps.headline: Take the remote on your hand, and hold it in front of the camera.
Look into the screen of the camera.
steps.description: While you are pressing the button, look at the light (which is normally doesn't light up by seeing with your naked eye – light of the sort of LED) but on the screen of the camera. A purple colour light will be visible. If the purple colour light is not visible, then your TV remote is broken.

text: Take a TV remote. Take any remote you want. Take a camera. Bring out a camera, such as a mobile phone's or a digital camera. Take the remote on your hand, and hold it in front of the camera.  Press any button. Press any button you like. Look into the screen of the camera. While you are pressing the button, look at the light (which is normally doesn't light up by seeing with your naked eye – light of the sort of LED) but on the screen of the camera. A purple colour light will be visible. If the purple colour light is not visible, then your TV remote is broken.
